headline.main: King Hussein Sought Israeli Help in '70

lead_paragraph: In 1970, King Hussein of Jordan made a plea -- the only one ever recorded from an Arab country -- for Israeli military support during the ''Black September'' revolt, according to British government files made public today. The official documents show that the king asked, through Britain and the United States, for Israeli air raids on the Syrian Army, which was supporting Palestinian guerrillas.
abstract: British government files show that in 1970 King Hussein of Jordan made plea, only one ever recorded from an Arab country, for Israeli military support during 'Black September' revolt in which Syrian Army was supporting Palestinian guerrillas (S)
